message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CC 

The paper deals with pliable index coding, which is a problem in information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The problem involves broadcasting information to multiple receivers, which suggests that cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also introduces new techniques to obtain better lower bounds, which could fall under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) or cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
